actions.name: Writing files
actions.description: Write to existing or new files.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Secret URL key to avoid unauthorized command execution.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: Repository name or remote URL of repository. You will have to pick a repository if this parameter is missing.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path of file written to relative to repository root without leading slash. You are asked to pick/create a file if this parameter is missing.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text written to file. The text parameter is transferred as UTF-8 but will be written in the encoding of the existing file or UTF-8 for new files. If you do not include either a text or base64 parameter the clipboard content is written.

parameters.name: base64
parameters.description: Binary data written to file in base64 format. If you do not include either a text or base64 parameter the clipboard content is written.

parameters.name: askcommit
parameters.description: Ask to commit and push after writing.

options.description: 0 - default : do not ask to commit
1 : ask to commit and push the file

parameters.name: append
parameters.description: Append to existing file instead of overwriting.

options.description: 0 - default : text, base64 or clipboard content replaces existing file
1 : text, base64 or clipboard content is appended to existing file

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: To avoid loosing information the command refuses to write to files that have uncommitted changes and this parameter changes this behaviour.

options.description: 0 - default : refuse to write to files with uncommitted changes
1 : allow overwriting files with uncommitted changes

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: When path hasn't been provided and user picks where to save, this parameter is the suggested filename of the new file.

parameters.name: uti
parameters.description: Universal Type Identifier expected of destination file. This is only used when path hasn't been provided and user picks where to save. User will be warned before picking a file with extension that doesn't match UTI. Default value is public.plain-text or public.item depending on whether content is specified with text or base64.
